subject: Science
title: Why Rocky Planets Are Close to the Sun
description: A quick, practical guide to Why Rocky Planets Are Close to the Sun.

hook.text: All four rocky planets orbit close to the Sun. The gas giants are far away. Why?

buildup.text: When the solar system formed, the inner disk was too hot for ice to survive.

discovery.text: Only rock and metal could condense near the Sun, forming small dense worlds.

twist.text: Beyond the frost line, ice could stick around â€” giving giant planets huge cores.

climax.text: Those icy cores grew fast enough to capture massive gas envelopes.

punchline.text: Temperature decided everything. Rock near the Sun, gas far away.

quiz.question: What is the frost line in the solar system?
options: Where ice could survive during formation
The edge of the Sun's light
